pain_points_original.title: Ensuring AI Data Security & Regulatory Compliance
pain_points_original.description: DPC must ensure any AI solution strictly complies with government ICT, security, and privacy policies (IPPs). The challenge is safeguarding sensitive government data, especially when using third-party LLMs, which poses a high-stakes risk of data breaches and non-compliance across government operations.

pain_points_original.title: Complex Integration with Existing Gov't Systems
pain_points_original.description: DPC faces significant risk integrating new AI into complex, existing government IT systems. The key challenge is assessing the maturity, scalability, and adaptability of vendor solutions to avoid operational disruption, protect legacy data, and guarantee the long-term viability of the AI investment.

pain_points_original.title: Lack of Predictable AI Costing for Budgeting
pain_points_original.description: DPC is unable to effectively plan or budget for AI adoption due to uncertainty around vendor pricing models. They require clear, indicative costing to build a solid business case, secure future funding, and avoid unexpected expenses that could derail procurement and large-scale implementation plans.

pain_points_original.title: Mitigating Risk with Proven Government Use Cases
pain_points_original.description: The department is risk-averse and must validate AI's effectiveness before committing to deployment. The challenge is identifying mature, reliable solutions with a proven history of success in similar government contexts to de-risk investment and ensure tangible benefits like efficiency gains are realized.

merge_decisions.kept: Ensuring AI Data Security & Regulatory Compliance
merge_decisions.merged: Complex Integration with Existing Gov't Systems
